author: Staff Reporter
text:
A 26-year-old man was sentenced to five years imprisonment for abetment of suicide by the Mahila Court here on Wednesday.

The case pertained to the suicide of a 17-year-old girl in 2010, after the accused Karthik stalked the victim after she had spurned his advances.

According to the prosecution, the accused Karthik, a resident of Malaisandhu in Krishnagiri was related to the victim as a distant brother.

The victim was visiting her grandmother’s house during her board exam vacation, when she was introduced to the accused Karthik.

Karthik had allegedly pursued the girl, long after she had returned to her home and joined a college for further studies.

The accused had continued to stalk the girl and had threatened her of kidnap, if she spurned his romantic interest. Hounded by the accused, she committed suicide.

Fine imposed

Delivering the verdict, Mahila Court judge Meera Sumathi sentenced Karthik to five-year term, and slapped a fine of Rs. 5,000.
title: Man sentenced to five years imprisonment for abetment of suicide
